STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 12, 2024
Lauryn Ritchie
Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
615 W. Lovell,
Kalamazoo, MI, 49007
Re: License #: CI390403045
SI #: 2024SIC0001226
Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
427 East Alcott St.
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001226
Special Investigation Intake Date: March 8, 2024
License #: CI390403045
Licensee Group Organization: Let's Talk About It CMH Services, PLLC
Licensee Designee: Tonya Moore
Chief Administrator: Lauryn Ritchie
Agency Name: Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
Agency Address: 615 W. Lovell
Kalamazoo, MI 49007
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2024
Capacity: 14
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
3/8/2024 Face to Face Entrance Conference;
Incident Notification;
Interview
3/8/2024 Email Documentation received
3/8/2024 Phone Interview
3/8/2024 Email Incident Notification
3/8/2024 Email Incident Notification
3/8/2024 Email Documentation received
3/8/2024 Email Safety Plan
3/13/2024 Email Documentation received
3/14/2024 Email Documentation received
3/20/2024 Face to Face Interview
1

3/21/2024 Email Documentation received
3/26/2024 Phone Interview
3/26/2024 Email Documentation received
3/27/2024 Face to Face Interview
3/27/2024 Phone Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code &
CCI R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section
Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff
on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Rumors are being heard that Youth B has been sexually assaulted
by Youth A. It's unknown when or where this occurred.
Investigation Complainant-Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 3/8/2024. She reported receiving an email from
Complainant 2 on 3/7/24 about the allegations. Once receiving the
email about the allegations, Complainant-Administrator 1 spoke
with Youth A who informed Complainant-Administrator 1 of being
approached by other individuals at school who reported Youth B
had informed them, Youth A had sexually assaulted Youth B.
Complainant-Administrator 1 sat in on the interview of both Youth
A and Youth B conducted by Law Enforcement. During the Law
Enforcement interview, Youth B informed Law Enforcement that
during Youth B’s first week at the facility while in the van, Youth A
touched the inside of Youth B’s thigh. Youth B also reported this to
Staff 1 and Staff 2, who were transporting the two youth at the
time. Youth B reported to be pressing charges because Youth B
doesn’t want Youth A to do the same behavior to anyone else.
When Youth A was interviewed, Youth A denied the entire
allegation. Complainant-Administrator 1 reported Youth A and
Youth B were in a relationship for about a week and have since
had a very disruptive relationship (drama) between themselves. A
2

safety plan was provided, and it was developed to help keep the
peace between Youth A and Youth B because of Youth B’s
bullying behaviors towards Youth A. Complainant-Administrator
1 was interviewed again face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. She reported being aware of an incident when Youth B
reported Youth A brushed Youth B’s leg in the vehicle on
1/8/2024. The next time she was informed of anything was when
the school called the facility, and a formal report was made.
Administrator 1 reported writing up Staff 1 and Staff 2 because
they were not following the safety plan as required but since all
staff have been very attentive to the safety plan.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/8/2024.
She reported being present during the transport of Youth A and
Youth B but never being informed of Youth A touching Youth B
until yesterday (3/7/24). She reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D were in the van during the transport and both Staff 1
and Staff 2 were present. Youth B makes wild allegations against
Youth A, saying Youth A is in love with Youth B and Youth B
becomes very jealous because Youth A has good relationships
with the other youth. Youth B does not like this and gets
dysregulated when Youth A speaks to boys during an outing. Staff
1 reported knowing of the safety plan and that staff will keep
Youth A and Youth B apart. Staff 1 reported when traveling in the
van, Youth A and Youth B are not allowed to sit in the same row
and must have staff sitting in the row between them. Currently,
Youth A and Youth B are not allowed to be alone together and not
allowed to speak to each other. Their bedrooms are on the same
floor but at opposite ends of the building.
Complainant 2 was interviewed via phone on 3/8/2024. She
reported being informed of the allegations by Youth A who came
to her “visibility upset” yesterday. Youth A reported classmates
informed Youth A, that Youth B said Youth A sexually assaulted
Youth B. Complainant 2 reported contacting the facility to report
the allegations. She reported Youth A and Youth B don’t like each
other and Youth B has a history of bullying Youth A to which
Complainant 2 has been a witness. Youth B also has a history of
making up things to get others in trouble.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. She reported being present in the van during the “two”
alleged incidents but did not directly observe Youth A touch Youth
B. She reported Staff 1 informed her Youth B reported being
touched by Youth A once they returned to the facility. Staff 2 told
Staff 1 to report the allegation to Administration. Staff 2 was
3

unable to identify the date this occurred. Staff 2 reported Youth A
took a dog from Youth B which may have caused a touch during
the removal of the dog. Youth A took this action because Staff 1
asked Youth A to remove the dog from Youth B and give the dog
to Staff 1. This action took place in the backseat of the van. Staff 1
was driving the van, and her dog was in the back seat. Staff 2 was
in the middle section and Youth A, Youth B, Youth D, and the dog
were in the back seat. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were
friends at the time and there was no safety plan for supervision
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 reported there is now a
safety plan where Youth A and Youth B are to be separated at all
times and not allowed communication between them. When riding
in the vehicle, Youth A and Youth B must sit far away from each
other.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. She reported not finding out about the allegations until
the school notified the facility. She reported never being told by
the former Chief Administrator who left the facility on 1/4/2024,
about the allegations. She found out about Youth A and Youth B
being in a relationship from another youth (unidentified) and
understood the relationship lasted one week before the conflict
between Youth A and Youth B began. Youth B started becoming
“mean” with Youth A and Youth A withdrew from the rest of the
group.. She reported Youth A gets a lot of attention because of
her artwork and this tends to make Youth B very jealous causing
Youth B to “taunt” Youth A when possible.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth B reported there were two times Youth A rubbed
Youth B’s inner thigh while in the facility vehicle. She was unable
to recall the dates of both incidents but believed the first incident
occurred before the prior Chief Administrator left (1/4/24). Youth B
didn’t say anything about the first incident because Youth B
believed it was an accident. Youth B reported she told Staff 1 and
Staff 2 about the second incident (unable to recall the date) and
believed they would let Administration know. Youth B reported
speaking with Administrator 1 and being told Administrator 1 knew
nothing about the allegations. Youth B reported feeling
uncomfortable about Youth A because Youth B’s sister was
sexually assaulted in the past. Youth B reported Youth A is going
around the facility telling “everyone everything” about what Law
Enforcement asked. Youth B reported there are now restrictions
and Youth A, and Youth B are not to have any contact with each
other. She reported staff do not keep Youth A and Youth B apart
and don’t follow directions as given by Administration. Youth C
4

and Youth D come to Youth B and inform Youth B of what Youth A
is saying about Youth B.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. She reported not knowing what is causing the
problems between Youth A and Youth B but strongly indicated
Youth B is lying and causing most of the issues. Youth C
observed Youth A and Youth B arguing in the back seat of the
vehicle but never observed any touching between them. Youth A
and Youth B liked each other but now don’t. Youth C reported
Youth A is not talking about Youth B but rather Youth B is talking
bad about Youth A. Staff do keep Youth A and Youth B separated
and both Youth A and Youth B stay away from each other. Youth
C feels safe at the facility and believes her needs are being met.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. She reported understanding Youth A and Youth B
were in a relationship but had differences and “got into it”. She
reported Youth A and Youth B appear to be trying to get the other
one in trouble. Youth D avoids the “drama”. During a van ride,
Youth D observed Youth B jump when Youth A said anything to
Youth B. Youth D denied observing Youth A ever touching Youth
B. Youth A and Youth B are now not allowed to sit next to each
other. Youth D reported staff keep them apart but at times, Youth
A and Youth B will get into the same room, but staff will watch
them closely. Youth D feels safe at the facility but gets frustrated
over the issues between Youth A and Youth B.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth A reported Youth B first approached Youth A to
engage in a relationship, but Youth A “brushed” Youth B off until
Youth B cornered Youth A in a room and told Youth A, Youth B
would be good for Youth A. The Chief Administrator caught Youth
A and Youth B in the room and told both Youth A and Youth B
they can’t be alone in a room. Youth A reported they dated for a
week before problems began. Youth A reported Youth B began to
ignore Youth A and leave the room when Youth A entered. While
riding in the vehicle, Youth B would begin to “shake and flinch”
when Youth A sat next to Youth B. Youth B told staff that Youth A
was coming on to Youth B, but Youth A reported being asexual
and having no sexual desire. Youth A reported a few weeks ago,
Youth B had a mental breakdown and told Youth A’s friends that
Youth A had sexually assaulted Youth B. Youth A reported Youth
A would never do that to anyone and denied touching Youth B.
Youth A denied remembering the incident with the dog during the
van ride. Youth A reported writing a grievance about Youth B
5

touching Youth A. Youth A reported not feeling safe at the facility
because of Youth B and stated it is scary that Youth B can make
up things in Youth B’s head. Youth A reported staff keep an eye
on Youth A and Youth B, but certain staff complain about having
to provide this level of supervision. Youth A refused to provide the
names of any staff that are not following the safety plan because
Youth A will not “snitch”.
Administrator 3 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. She
reported Youth A never filed a grievance as Youth A had reported.
She reported Staff 1 has left the facility and reported feeling
uncomfortable around the youth as the reason to end her
employment which occurred yesterday (3/25/24).
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. He reported
being familiar with the safety plan for Youth A and Youth B and
that it focuses around keeping them apart. Youth A and Youth B
are to have no communication nor interactions. Youth A and
Youth B are to be kept out of the same room at the same time if
possible. He reported having weekly meetings on Wednesdays to
discuss issues which include the safety plan. He did not recall any
issues in following through with the safety plan and knows of no
staff that failed to follow through.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. She reported
she was aware of the safety plan. Youth A and Youth B are to be
kept separated and Staff 5 believed she has been successful at
this task. She reported Youth A and Youth B are following the
safety plan.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. She reported
each Wednesday, the staff meet to discuss issues with youth and
the safety plan. She reported following the safety plan and knew
of no staff that was not following the safety plan.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. Staff 7
reported knowing the safety plan and what actions staff are to take
to keep Youth A and Youth B separated. Staff 7 reported
attending the meetings on Wednesdays to gain more information
about actions staff are to take. Staff 7 reported having little
problem keeping Youth A and Youth B apart.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. Staff 8
reported he works 3rd shift, so Youth A is generally asleep when
he gets to work and has little issue keeping Youth A and Youth B
apart. He attends the meetings on Wednesday.
6

Staff 9 was interviewed via phone on 3/26/2024. Staff 9
reported because she works 3rd shift Youth A and Youth B are
only awake for about an hour during the shift. She attends the
meetings on Wednesdays and knows to keep Youth A and Youth
B separate.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/27/2024. She reported never observing staff not following the
safety plan for Youth A and Youth B. The assigned staff are
always with each youth and all staff attend the Wednesday
meeting to discuss the safety plan.
Staff 10 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/27/2024. She reported just beginning her employment at the
facility but understood the safety plan and her responsibilities.
Staff 11 was interviewed via phone on 3/27/2024. She reported
working 3rd shift and understanding staff’s responsibilities for the
safety plan for Youth A and Youth B. She denied observing staff
not following through with the safety plan.
Documents Reviewed:
High Alert LTAI Home Safety Plan dated 2/17/24. This
document outlines the actions staff are to take to keep Youth A
and Youth B safe. The reason this document was developed is
because of the concerns of inappropriate relationships and/or
bullying between both Youth A and Youth B. There are five
developed “provisions”. Youth A and Youth B are to be separated
in day-to-day programming, team assignments, mealtimes, and
scheduled outings. Youth A and Youth B are to alternate in-person
schooling and in separate trade certification classes. If the group
is engaged in watching a movie, Youth A and Youth B are to sit
next to their respective staff. Youth A and Youth B are not to share
a couch together. If Youth A or Youth B go upstairs the other
youth is to stay downstairs unless it is bedtime, then staff are
always to be present. If either Youth A or Youth B refuses to follow
directions, staff are to stay between them and staff are to contact
“on-call, House Manager, or Chief Administrator”.
Round Table Lovell dated 2/7/24 and 2/21/24. This document
outlines the staff present and important issues with each youth in
the program. Youth A is noted to be kept separate from Youth B
and receive Psychoeducation on healthy relationships,
boundaries, and high-risk situations.
7

Round Table Lovell dated 2/28/24. This document outlines the
staff present and important issues with each youth in the program.
Youth A is to continue to be separated from Youth A due to
continued concerns. Youth B continues to act out violently and
engaging in threatening behaviors with other youth in the
community and at the facility. Youth B was “kicked’ out of the
trade program at school by the school administration.
Staff meeting dated Monday 2/12/24 at the Lovell location.
This document outlines communication of information to staff
involving numerous issues and actions they are to undertake.
Staff are to keep Youth A and Youth B in close proximity at all
times and to keep an eye on both of them. Youth A and Youth B
are to be kept separate at all times and involved in separate team
activities.
Discussion memo dated 3/7/24 from Administrator 1 to all
staff. This memo outlines the issues between Youth A and Youth
B and how they are to be supervised at all times and kept
separated all the time. Staff must be in close proximity to both
youth at all times and when transporting Youth A, and Youth B are
to sit in different rows. Youth B is identified as the aggressor
(trying to get near Youth A) and “trying to lead Youth A on”. It is
highlighted “THEY ARE NOT TO HAVE CONTACT”. Staff are to
report any efforts Youth A or Youth B make to have contact with
the other and document this action in the communication log daily.
Residential Initial Service Plan dated 1/3/2024 (Addendum on
1/11/2024) for Youth B. This document outlines and notes Youth
B’s history of bullying others. It is noted Youth B was placed on
probation for making a false report with a threat of terrorism;
identity theft, falsifying a report to commit a crime and malicious
use of telecommunication. Youth B was reported to have created
a duplicate social media account and used this account to
threaten herself. It is also documented, Youth B struggled with
engaging in inappropriate sexual behaviors.
Residential Updated Service Plan dated 3/4/2024 for Youth B.
This document outlines, Youth B’s progress in the program. Youth
B has struggled with emotional regulation, appropriate boundaries,
and become violently aggressive towards other youth and staff. At
this time Youth B is separated from the other youth in the facility
and at school. Youth B is documented as displaying
hypersexuality behaviors and desiring to engage in an
inappropriate relationship with Youth A. Several times it was
8

discovered Youth B has engaged in inappropriate sexual
conversations with other individuals in the community via Gmail.
The school has caught Youth B engaging in inappropriate
searches related to sexual content when using the computer at
school. The documented goals for Youth B include involvement in
trauma-based group to understand the effect of trauma on Youth
B’s life, development of healthy boundaries with others, and active
participant in the programing
Residential Updated Service Plan dated 12/28/23 for Youth A.
There is no documentation in this report of Youth A displaying any
inappropriate sexual behaviors or thinking. Youth A is documented
as not showing any indications of past sexual abuse and is
displaying appropriate sexual awareness, behavior, and interests.
LTAI Community Mental Health Services, Inc – Incident
Report for Youth B dated 2/26/24. This incident report involves
Youth B being asked to leave the Trade program following an
outburst towards Youth A during a transition time between
classes. Youth B became visibly upset when observing Youth A,
sharing feelings about a male student while walking to class.
Youth B began to yell that Youth A was a “hoe” and that Youth B
was “going to expose Youth A”.
LTAI Community Mental Health Services, Inc – Incident
Report for Youth A dated 3/7/24. This incident report outlines
Youth A informing staff that Youth B was spreading rumors about
Youth A at school. Once back at the facility, Youth A was provided
space and support throughout the evening to ensure Youth A’s
emotional safety. Youth A was also escorted away from the facility
with staff so they could process the information Youth A had.
LTAI Community Mental Health Services, Inc – Incident
Report for Youth B dated 3/7/24. This incident report outlines
when Youth B was telling peers at school that Youth A had
touched Youth B inappropriately. Youth B became frustrated when
not being told where the information came from for the MDHHS
report. Staff offered Youth B space to vent and calm down when
returning to the facility.
Meeting notes for 2/26/24 with Youth A, Youth B,
Administrator 1, Case Manager, Staff 1, and Staff 2. This
document outlines the discussion of the continued inappropriate
interactions between Youth A and Youth B and these interactions
are identified as; Verbal Aggression, Inappropriate Boundaries,
Physical Threats, Sharing Personal Information, Rumors, and
9

Passive Aggressive Comments/Intimidation. Both Youth A and
Youth B were informed they must follow the plan of avoiding
interactions between them and maintain this separation.
Behavior Modification Plan dated last updated 2/23/24 for
Youth B. This document outlines the actions Youth B is to take to
ensure the environment is safe for Youth B and other youth in the
facility. Youth B is to refrain from engaging in verbal or physical
aggression, take prescribed medication, attend to education
requirements, attend individual therapy weekly, follow facility
rules, communicate needs appropriately, follow computer
expectations, and not AWOLP from the facility.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed.
Documentation indicates Staff 1 was hired 11/14/2023 and had no
one disciplinary action documented in her file. Staff 1 received a
written warning for allowing Youth A and Youth B to sit next to
each other during dinner on 2/28/24. Staff 1 is up to date in
training.
Human Resources file for Staff 2 was reviewed.
Documentation indicates Staff 2 was hired 11/16/2023 and had
one disciplinary action documented in her file. Staff 2 received a
written warning for allowing Youth A and Youth B to sit next to
each other during dinner on 2/28/24. Staff 2 is up to date in
training.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as the agency developed a
safety plan after it was alleged of inappropriate interactions and
the staff have continued to follow the required safety plan.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
10

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
4/8/2024
__________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 12, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
